home.title: Marie Mwape Kashimbo
home.heroTitle: Marie Mwape Kashimbo â€¢ Advocate for Social Progress & Community Empowerment
home.heroSubtitle: Founder of FMMPS | Champion of Vulnerable Communities in Kisangani & Tshopo
home.subtitle: Driven by Compassion, Committed to Change
home.heroText: Congolese philanthropist, founder of the FMMPS Foundation, and emerging political figure dedicated to transforming lives in the Democratic Republic of Congo.
home.missionText: To create lasting change through compassionate action, supporting the most vulnerable in our society while advocating for better governance and social justice.
home.aboutText: Marie Mwape Kashimbo â€¢ fondly known as "Maman Bolingo" â€¢ is a Congolese philanthropist, community leader, and emerging political figure. Since founding the FMMPS in 2021, she has led transformative efforts for vulnerable communities across Tshopo province.
home.aboutText2: Her unwavering dedication to social justice and human dignity has made her a beacon of hope for thousands of people, earning her recognition as one of the most influential community leaders in the Democratic Republic of Congo.
home.achievementsSubtitle: Milestones that mark our journey of impact and transformation
home.foundationSubtitle: Three pillars of transformation in our communities
home.joinText: Together, we can create meaningful change and build a better future for all Congolese people. Your support makes the difference.

about.title: About Marie Mwape Kashimbo
about.subtitle: A Life Dedicated to Service
about.biography: Marie Mwape Kashimbo is a prominent Congolese philanthropist and social activist who has dedicated her life to improving the conditions of the most vulnerable populations in the Democratic Republic of Congo. Through her unwavering commitment to social justice and human dignity, she has become a beacon of hope for thousands of people.
about.valuesText: Guided by principles of compassion, integrity, and social responsibility, Marie believes in the power of collective action to create meaningful change. Her work spans across multiple sectors including healthcare, education, and social welfare.
about.journeyText: From her early days as a community organizer to founding the FMMPS Foundation and entering the political arena, Marie's journey reflects her deep commitment to serving others and building a better future for all Congolese people.
about.coreValuesSubtitle: The principles that guide every decision and action in our mission
about.timelineSubtitle: Key milestones in Marie's path of service and leadership
about.personalSubtitle: Behind the scenes with Marie Mwape Kashimbo
about.achievementsSubtitle: Milestones that mark our journey of impact and transformation

foundation.title: FMMPS Foundation
foundation.subtitle: Transforming Lives Through Compassionate Action
foundation.overview: The FMMPS Foundation, founded by Marie Mwape Kashimbo, is dedicated to supporting the most vulnerable members of society including orphans, people with disabilities, albinos, and those facing mental health challenges.
foundation.impactText: Through direct intervention and community support programs, the Foundation has touched thousands of lives, providing essential services, healthcare, and hope to those who need it most.
foundation.impactSubtitle: Our comprehensive approach to supporting vulnerable populations
foundation.gallerySubtitle: Moments that capture the heart of our mission

political.title: Political Journey
political.subtitle: Advocating for Change Through Governance
political.nogecText: In July 2025, Marie Mwape Kashimbo joined NOGEC (National Organization for Good Governance and Change), marking her formal entry into the political arena to advocate for better governance and social policies.
political.advocacyText: Her political platform focuses on social welfare, healthcare reform, education access, and creating policies that protect the most vulnerable populations in Congolese society.
political.goalsText: Working towards comprehensive social reform, improved healthcare systems, and governance structures that prioritize human dignity and social justice.

media.title: Media & News
media.subtitle: Coverage and Recognition
media.recognitionText: Marie's work has been recognized through various awards and media coverage, highlighting her significant contributions to Congolese society.

getInvolved.subtitle: Join Us in Making a Difference
getInvolved.volunteerText: Join our team of dedicated volunteers and help us expand our reach in communities across the DRC.
getInvolved.donateText: Your contribution helps us continue our vital work supporting vulnerable populations.
getInvolved.contactText: Get in touch to learn more about our work or discuss partnership opportunities.

responses.foundation: The FMMPS Foundation, founded in 2021, focuses on three main pillars: Food & Essentials Distribution, Infrastructure Advocacy, and Community Events. Marie has helped over 1000+ people across Tshopo province.
responses.political: Marie joined NOGEC (National Organization for Good Governance and Change) in July 2025 to amplify her advocacy work through formal politics, focusing on social welfare and healthcare reform.
responses.volunteer: You can get involved by visiting our "Get Involved" section where you can volunteer, donate, or contact us directly. We always need passionate people to help our cause!
responses.about: Marie Mwape Kashimbo, known as "Maman Bolingo," is a Congolese philanthropist and community leader who has dedicated her life to supporting vulnerable populations in DRC.
responses.contact: You can reach Marie through our contact form, email at contact@mariemwape.org, or through our social media channels. We'd love to hear from you!
responses.default: Thank you for your question! For more detailed information, please visit the relevant sections of our website or contact us directly.

values.compassionDesc: Deep empathy drives every action we take for our community
values.communityDesc: Building stronger bonds through collective action and support
values.impactDesc: Creating measurable, lasting change in people's lives
